title: Good for a few months... then it fried.
content: Worked well for a few months. Last night it started squeaking and then just quit working. It fried. I guess for under $20 it worked for a while, but i'd still rather pay for something that would at least last through the summer.

title: Two Stars
content: Doesn't blow very hard.

title: Two Stars
content: too small and weak imo

title: Two Stars

title: Two Stars

title: What the .....
content: My issue with this fan is it's design. It can ONLY PIVOT UP 90 degrees. As if I need air directed to my ceiling.  Why didn't they design this to rotate 360 degrees so that it can be angled at just the right direction to suit the user. Unbelievable! If I knew this I would not have purchased this item.

title: Not a turbo fan, doesn't compare to Vornados. Not recommended.
content: This is not a turbo force fan at all, doesn't compare to Vornado. This is good for 3-5 feet of air at the highest setting. Not sure what I can use it for, doesn't move enough air to be a circulator. On the plus side it is fairly quiet at the lower 2 speeds, but not the highest speed.
I would not recommend this.

title: new version not as good as old version
content: new version may be 25% quieter but it's 66% less effective. if you only need the low setting (or lower) on the original, then the new version is fine but if you want the old medium or high settings, look elsewhere.

title: Two Stars
content: May be a fine 12" fan, but as a 15" fan it doesn't measure up.

title: Basic table fan. Nothing special.
content: This is a basic table fan. The other reviewers are exaggerating the capabilities of this fan. The best use is as a personal fan sitting 5 feet from you.

title: White -- Click -- Click -- Click -- Noise -- Click -- Click -- FAIL.
content: While it does the job of providing a good amount of airflow at three different settings, it began 'clicking' upon each spin after about a month of use. Since this was purchased mainly for white noise, it is extremely distracting. This has been the first time I've been disappointed with a purchase on Amazon and hoping it's the last.

content: Worked well for a few months. Last night it started squeaking and then just quit working. It fried. I guess for under $20 it worked for a while, but i'd still rather pay for something that would at least last through the summer.

title: Quiet, low cost but very weak output.
content: Compared with a similar size metal fan this fan is weak.  My "polar aire" from bi-mart knocks this down.  The upside is cost, and it's quiet.  But as far as wind velocity goes it's weak.

title: I have purchased two of these same fans and the ...
content: I have purchased two of these same fans and the output is not the same. This second one i bought is noticeably weaker than the other when compared at the same power settings.

title: It's a nice compact design
content: It's a nice compact design, and is very quiet, but does not blow a lot of air. The "high" setting is what I'd consider a medium.

title: Two Stars
content: Thought it would blow stronger. It works okay

title: Poor quality
content: Quit working after 2 months of regular use.

title: TurboForce it is not...
content: Tiny little fan that blows a tiny amount of air.  I believe I will return.  Even on high there is Nothing "TurboForce"  about this fan! I was duped by the name.

title: Fan is fine at lowest setting but hardly blows any air at ...
content: Fan is fine at lowest setting but hardly blows any air at that speed. The other speed settings result in an annoying rattle coming from the fan somewhere. I can't recommend this fan but at $10 you get what you pay for.

title: Crap
content: The middle speed never worked on this fan. After 8 months of use, overwhelmingly on low speed, this fan has ceased to work. This is an abysmally short service life, even for a cheap fan. Just wonder if if was a factory second ...

title: It's VERY quiet because it hardly pushes any air at ...
content: It's VERY quiet because it hardly pushes any air at all. Noise I can deal with, constantly checking the speed setting on the fan thinking for the 5th time that I have it set on low when in fact I don't, no, no that I can't deal with. Already shopping for new house fans.

title: Wish it was beter
content: I was told the fan puts out a good air flow only if you are right in front of it.

title: Don't like it
content: Very underpowered high speed feels like it's on low not happy

title: Average Fan...
content: Quieter means it moves less air by the way.  It works ok but not that powerful.

title: didn't really cool me
content: Not that powerful, didn't really cool me off

title: 75% LESS Powerful than the predecessor
content: i had this same fan ten years ago and it was great, but the version I received here is probably 75% LESS Powerful than the predecessor. I do not recommend

title: Much too gentle breeze
content: We had three of the old version of these fans for about four years, used them a lot.  They began to get noisy so we decided to replace all three.  The new ones look the same and are exactly the same size but the motor is much weaker than the original.  It pushes less air so what the old ones could do on speed 2 the new ones need to be on the highest speed 3.  The box claims they are 25% quieter, not a surprise since they must be at least 25% less powerful.

title: Would buy something else
content: Not much air movement unless you are sitting right in front of it.

title: OK, but gives off a strong plastic smell.
content: Works great but WARNING: gives off a horrible plastic smell.  After 1 month of running it every day and it still fills the room with plastic smell

title: It cools pretty good though
content: The title floor fan made me think it would be a lil bigger. It cools pretty good though.

title: Weak to Start, Bad After 1 Year
content: I bought this fan 13 months ago. The high ratings and popularity of this fan on Amazon convinced me to buy it.

title: Five Stars
content: Great CFM fan for the money, IMO.  Just wish it had oscillate too :)

title: Moves a lot of air quietly, but offgassed PVC smell.
content: This fan is whisper quiet and moves a good amount of air in a large living space. Plastic (PVC?) smells like chlorine. Made the room smell like chlorine when on. We are sensitive to chemicals, so this was returned. Bought another Holmes Box Fan. Those are always good. Noisier, but satisfactory and not smelly.

title: The smaller version is much better.
content: Not as silent as expected. Makes random motor noises. The smaller version is much better.

title: Disappointed in quality deterioration since I bought the first model ...
content: Disappointed in quality deterioration since I bought the first model a few years ago. It's the same fan but much less plastic and power.

title: Honeywell Whole Room Air Circulator Floor/Table Fan
content: moves  10 - 20 - 30% more air. does make more noise 7 - 20 - 32%. (smaller diameter blade). this was metered. blade pitch angle not consistent.

title: Love the Rotating head and Portability
content: The rotating stand of this fan broke off just a year after!! I am now using rubber bands and other furniture to prop it up.

title: Two Stars
content: Lasted about 6 months.

title: Too Loud to Use at Desk
content: Fan puts out a decent amount of air. It isn't very cool but it will circulate the current hot air around. It's also way too loud to have at a desk. Not thrilled with this purchase at all. I found a much better fan for a just a few dollars more that is better in every single way.

title: Second one purchased has much less power
content: I purchased this fan a few months ago and it was amazing so purchased another for my husband - the second one has only half the power of the original. It must have been redesigned with a loss of power.

title: Two Stars
content: Previously purchased same fan but larger size. Did not realize from the picture that this model fan is smaller

title: it did a good job of providing white noise for sleep and blowing ...
content: Our newest one lasted less than 1 year with nightly use on low or medium.  We had one before (I assume it was the HT-800) that lasted a few years.  While it was working, it did a good job of providing white noise for sleep and blowing air if I was working at my desk.

title: Died after 2 years of use!
content: Loved this little fan, but it only lasted a little over two years before it bit the dust!  I've had another model (looks exactly the same as this one) for almost eight years and it's still in great condition.  Very disappointed that the quality of this fan was not better as it is the perfect size and makes just enough white noise for sleeping.

title: Two Stars
content: Very noisy. Does not drop the room temperature measurably.

title: It's like there is a clutch mechanism that gets stuck
content: Worked well and as advertised. Then after about 6mos it started getting stuck. You turn it on and the fan blades make one rotation and stop. You can hear the motor straining. It's like there is a clutch mechanism that gets stuck.

title: Two Stars
content: I thought that this fan it was stronger.

title: Two Stars
content: doesnt put out much air

title: Defective switch and WAY TOO QUIET! This is not a fan for hardcore sleeping-fan fans!
content: My fan arrived defective. The fan doesn't come on unless you wiggle the switch, and it smells like burning electric. But the two star rating is as much for the design as for the faulty electrical components. I've had an older model of the Honeywell fan for about 8 years. I run it all night every night for white noise and air circulation. The older model is a heavy, durable plastic and the noise level is perfect as white noise. This new model feels cheap, and it barely makes any sound. Level 3 on this one makes as much white noise as level 1 on the older model. I'm very disappointed in this change from Honeywell. There was a time when they made the perfect fan. I'm going to take my old one to an electrician to see if it can be fixed. I'd gladly pay double the cost of a new one to get my old one working again. "25% quieter" is not a positive selling point, Honeywell! My fan is being returned on Monday.

title: Not WHOLE Room circulation
content: very weak air movement... no way it will circulate air in any room... maybe a small closet ...

title: loud for an office
content: fan is powerful but very loud for an office space

title: Two Stars
content: not loud enough

title: Don't waste your money
content: What a disappointment over our previous fan.  Yeah, it's quieter... because the amperage isn't nearly what it used to be.  Even on high I seriously have to wave my hand in front of this to tell that it's on - because I can't feel any air movement at any real distance away from it.  Save your money and try something else.  Also - for white noise it is completely worthless, so don't bother.

title: you have to hand move it which sucks especially when you really want the air to circulate
content: i rated this fan with 2 stars. it works but you really can't tell a difference between the different levels, they are all equal to the lowest level. it doesnt move side to side either. you have to hand move it which sucks especially when you really want the air to circulate. if you are in desperate need of a fan then get this one but otherwise pass on this and pay a little more for something thats a whole lot better.

title: You get what you pay for...or don't get what you don't pay for.
content: Lasted 5 months before making an ugly sound and crapping out. It's fine if you use a fan once in a while...but it's horrible as a desk fan that you'd use a lot.

title: Two Stars
content: Barely feel the breeze

title: not a good option for constant circulation
content: use this daily to help the bathroom air circulate.  i guess that is too much usage as it keeps going out.  not happy with this purchase.  will have to look elsewhere to replace and use often

title: ... a period of a year purchased two fans to cool the back of computers
content: Over a period of a year purchased two fans to cool the back of computers. The year-old fan died.  Honeywell used to be known for quality. A quality fan should last 5 years or more, like in the "good old days" of 1990s, 1980s, 1970s, 1960s, 1950s.  Shun Honeywell or replace every year.  Pros: It is fairly quiet and can be pointed at various angles most fans don't go, and a relatively good air flow for small space/room.

title: Stopped Working After 7 mos.
content: Bought in Nov 2014.  Dead in June 2015.  Not the quality standard I expected from a Honeywell product.  Plus, it costs $10 prepaid to return the product.  I bought a fan for $2 at a yard sale that's lasted 2X as long.  And who is KAZ?  That's who you ship defective product to.  Buying from Amazon is getting to be like a box of chocolates.

title: Worked fine for about a year
content: Worked fine for about a year.  Then stopped.  Probably a defective unit.  Liked well enough that I might take a chance on another one.

title: Two Stars
content: Not much air flow

title: Two Stars
content: Rattles

title: It's not as powerful as my larger Honeywell fan. ...
content: It's not as powerful as my larger Honeywell fan. This is definitely more of a desk fan. I bought it with the intention of cooling down my son's room, but with the heat wave, it just wasn't doing the trick. I'd suggest the lister put down suggestions for its use.

title: Two Stars
content: It's too small and the wind is not strong enough.

title: I know Honeywell has fantastic products, Heating and air conditioning electronics
content: I know Honeywell has fantastic products, Heating and air conditioning electronics. I thought this would follow that tradition. Well, maybe I didn't look carefully enough. But, when i got this to fight the hot and humid conditions of South Carolina, The box said this is a room circulatory. I wanted a powerful blast in the face. I guess I should have bought the 10" Fan.

title: Disappointengly Small
content: This is a small fan.

title: Cannot recommend for solar purposes
content: Watching energy consumption.  My new purchase uses 22.2 Watts on high,  20 on medium, and 19 on low.  Electrically, I will use on high.

title: Not for a whole room
content: This fan is more for your small bedroom, pointed right at you while you sleep. Doesn't have much oomph.

title: Did great for about 5 months
content: Did great for about 5 months, and then went to hell. Makes the most awful noise ever. Will be ordering something to replace this POS.

title: thought it was big
content: Too small

title: The fan worked great for about two years of intermittent use
content: I had the same experience as other buyers.  The fan worked great for about two years of intermittent use.  Then the stand broke at the place where it connects to the fan.  The other side of the fan has hairline cracks around the connection.  It seems like a poor design based on the experience of other reviewers.  I would not buy another.

title: Did not last for two years.
content: It was great when it was working. But in less than two year, the stand that holds the fan broke and now we have to replace it. It plastic just snapped where the screws are joined to the fan. Now we have to a replacement fan.

title: Two Stars
content: Doesn't put out much air and very very quiet.

title: Very, very noisy.
content: Makes A LOT of noise. It feels great on the high setting which is obviously the noisiest. Can't hardly feel the lowest setting which is quiet.

title: good for 6 months.....not good past a year
content: bought it on July 04, 2014 (today its July 20, 2015) so I had it for a year. I use it roughly  8- 10 hours daily since day one. as of right now, I am looking for to replace this fan because the noises it makes. It has been making screeching noises at certain angles around 3 months ago. I would fix this by readjusting the angle. But now it randomly cycles through a screeching frenzy. while sleeping, I would sometimes awake because of the amount of noise it would make.

title: Dissapointing air movement.  Nothing like the writeup in the listing.
content: After reading about how much air this fan moves, I was VERY disappointed with the low volume of air moved.  You can bearly tell it is moving any air.  If it was nay less, I would return it.  Have not had it long enough to have any additional problems.

title: Not that great.
content: It's quiet and somewhat powerful for a smaller fan. However, it only points straight forward or up, you can't tilt it down at all. The worst part is the positioning is impossible, if you lightly touch it or try to adjust the speed settings, it starts tilting up, it doesn't stay in place. When it changes positions it makes a loud clicking noise. Also, for a tabletop fan it is quite large. It does not fit on most nightstands unless you have nothing else on the table. The speed settings knob is a hassel to reach. Will be a super hot day backup fan only from now on

title: Two Stars
content: 2 of the fans stopped working after 6 months of use.

title: Not built like they used to be... Updated 9/24/15
content: Bought this because we had two others just like this one that lasted for more than 6 years.  This one started squeaky randomly on low at 3 months and now won't start up on it's own - we have to kick start it with a pointed object - which means the bearings are already going out. If we leave it on all the time it seems to be fine and it stopped squeaking.  But I'm still not impressed.  The last fans didn't start doing this until they were 4 years old.

title: Died within 2 months
content: I have the smaller version for my office at work so I decided to get the bigger one for my bedroom at home.  I don't think the motor can hold up to constant use.  The office one I have had for a year but gets turned off every night.  My bedroom one gets used a lot more. Today i found it to be off and realized that while the motor "works" the blades do NOT spin.  Not happy camper

title: I bought this hoping it would be a 1/2 price ...
content: I bought this hoping it would be a 1/2 price alternative to a similar Vornado fan that I use in another room.  Two characteristics make it not a viable alternative for me.  1) Much weaker airflow.  2) Can't be rotated past vertical to blow onto the floor-- I don't need straight down, just a click or two past vertical to help with drying the carpet after a spill.

title: Definitely not for a "whole room"
content: Should have listened to the other reviewers -- this thing is weak. Not sure if it has been in the past, but as of my 6/7/15 order it definitely is. To be honest I don't have much of a measuring stick for it, but when I read "whole room" air circulator I assumed it meant that. Unfortunately I can't even feel it unless I am sitting directly in front of it in by small 300sqft apartment living room. Pros are: fairly quiet, and cheap. At least I'll have it as backup to sit in front of if times get desperate.

title: Not a Whole Room Fan!
content: This fan is not what I wanted.  It is much smaller than I needed, but hard to know what you get from the description. I was trying to an older and larger Honeywell fan I had for years.  I paid way too much for this fan.  It's worth no more than about $20. At max speed, air movement for this fan is what I expected for medium or even low speed.  Medium and low speed hardly move any air at all, so they are pretty much useless.  Those speed might be OK if the fan is facing you from 15 feet away, but this fan market's itself as a whole room fan - it's NOT!

title: Does not cool well.
content: It's just to small. Does not cool well.

title: I still am keeping it cuz it works as a window fan
content: I was looking for a more powerful loud fan, Honeywell has quieted thier newer fans, which for me, is not what I want!

title: Two Stars
content: Motor seized up after 1 year

title: Not My Definition of Quiet
content: Makes enough noise to require the TV sound to be turned up.

title: because the fan is so low on the ground, ...
content: because the fan is so low on the ground, I have found it in effective in a bedroom. If you place it on a dresser, it's ok, but at that point I might as well have bought a fan on a stand

title: Fan great---mounting stand breaks at the slightest movement!
content: First off, the fan is very powerful and works great, BUT, don't plan on moving it very much because the plastice that mounts it is very cheap. One day, I bent down to move the angle of it and the left side broke chipped off slightly, so when I picked it up to see if I could fix it somehow, the right side completely broke off. The fan still works, but now I have to lean it against a stack of books to adjust it. It is not worth $25.

title: Throwaway
content: I bought this fan in May of 2014. In May or June of this year (2015) the fan cut out right when I went to sleep. I managed to turn it off quickly and had my father, an industrial mechanic, take it apart and add more oil. Today, about a month or two later it did the same thing again. The price is just reasonable enough to avoid a one star. My biggest issue is that it seems like Honeywell has seemingly hooked customers by better products. We have a double fan by them that has run excellently for well over five years. Then they introduce throwaway stuff like this.

title: Two Stars
content: Makes too much noise. Something is not right with my fan.

title: Buy vornado
content: If u want cheap perhaps dispisable it's OK. Buy a Vornado w more strength, little more noise, 5 year warranty and much easier to clean inside.

title: I do not like it
content: Well, for this price, I really believed this fan would be 4 x its size.  It throws minimal coolness, even on the highest of settings.  I did not like it at all.  I should have returned it; however, my adult son is using it, pointed directly on him, while he sleeps in a room being cooled by a larger, swivelling fan.  The shipping was sort of quick and the item came well packaged with no damage.

title: Two Stars
content: weak

title: I'm glad we aren't in our hot dorm room with this ...
content: What happened to this Honeywell?!?!  We owned the 800 series in college, and so I thought this would be the same thing.  It does not have the power or cooling power that the older model offered.  I'm glad we aren't in our hot dorm room with this one.  It does provide a gentle breeze and is very quiet.

title: Don't Believe Everything You Read
content: After reading the reviews, this looked like a great fan.  I ordered 4 for the cat kennels at the shelter I volunteer at.  First, one came broken.  I sent it back and it was replaced quickly.  Now, a couple of months after the purchase, another one just stopped working.  So don't believe everything you read.

title: Not good for white noise
content: Bought this to replace one just like it that I've had for years to use as white noise. Very disappointed that they made it so quiet, it's useless for white noise.

title: Two Stars
content: not very powerful

title: At first it seemed fine but then I noticed it was making a high ...
content: At first it seemed fine but then I noticed it was making a high pitched squeal-like sound. Very distracting.

title: Two Stars
content: Just Ok

title: Two Stars
content: Stand broke after 1 year fans getting slower

title: Won't Be Cool With This Fan!
content: The high speed on this fan is the low speed on every other fan.

title: Good product but does not last long enough
content: Worked well for 2 month and then failed on me. For the period it worked, it was a very good product

title: Two Stars
content: Turbo is far from accurate with this product!  On high it barley moved the air.  I returned it.

title: Fan doesn't tilt down, only up.
content: The fan seems pretty sturdy and I love how quiet it is. However, I purchased this fan specifically for the tilt, to tilt it down. And apparently the fan can't tilt down, only up. I read through several reviews and all the specs and it was never specified. I assumed the "tilt" went both ways. Guess I was wrong.

title: New Version is Not a Better Version
content: This is an okay fan, if you had the prior version you will be a bit disappointed as I was. I've had a few of these Honeywell fans for more than 10 years and this was the first one I found disappointing. While this is quieter than the old model, it's only quieter due to a large reduction in power. The highest speed is between the low and medium speed of the prior version. We used this primarily to make white noise at night so it does that, just not as loudly. I would put this fan on the weaker end of the fan spectrum, almost like a battery powered fan. Only gets 2 stars as it should be cheaper for what you get than it is.

title: Too big
content: The base is very big

title: Bad build quality and a short shelf life make this fan a bad investment
content: Bought mine in July of 2014, it worked fine for about a year before problems arose, and now it doesn't work at all. The "whole room air circulation" claim seems like a load of marketing fluff, but I suppose if you work out the airflow in your room and aim the fan precisely you can achieve such air circulation nirvana. For most consumers, though, I would imagine you just want this thing to blow cool air when you're sweating out hot summers, and this fan does a decent job. The way it pushes air is that it pushes it out in a wide angle, so if you just point the fan at you you're likely not going to feel as good a breeze if you just use this to try and push the hot air around you away, Unfortunately, like others have stated the build quality of this fan is pretty sketchy, as my fan broke off from the base very easily within a year of normal use. So even if you think you have the most gentile of touches, I recommend just finding the perfect spot for this fan and then rarely if ever trying to move it lest you want to accidentally break it off of the base.

title: Hardly any wind
content: Hardly any wind

title: Not very powerful and way too quiet for white noise
content: This fan has very limited power and a range of only a few feet.  Do not use this fan as a white noise machine, as it is way too quiet for that.  If you're looking for a desk fan for your office, this is a decent choice.  Otherwise, I would avoid.

title: Honeywell product stopped working suddenly!
content: I purchased three of these fans in July.  I only opened one to be used immediately and know it is broken.  It just stopped working.  I've been using Honeywell fans for decades now and other than some noise when the fan blades turn (after a year or so of use) I've never had any trouble with these products.  I know that the product is guaranteed for a year.  What I don't know is how I go about swapping the broken one for a brand new one.  I thought you would like to know about the trouble I'm facing and maybe someone will get in touch with me about resolving this issue.

title: Well it works. but.....
content: Well it's a fan. And works like a fan should, but one of the legs on the base broke. I wish it was more durable.

title: Weak sauce!
content: With a name like "TurboForce" you would think it would be a fairly powerful fan...It's not! Very weak. And much larger in size than I expected. A little too big to use as a desktop fan for cooling my hard drive docking station.

title: Two Stars
content: Not powerful at all compared to previous models.

title: Ok fan, until it slows down when it sucks ...
content: When buying this fan it was to replace my other small fan that I used nightly and it does make some of the white noise that I need to sleep but this fan somehow sucks up any and all hair and dust and then it shuts down the motor. Like cmon. I never had this problem with my old fan.

title: Turbo-fan
content: Fan is quieter than previous models in the past.  However, hi speed is not as powerful.  Also makes a funny noise while on High.

title: Works well but poor structure
content: The fan worked well for cooling off a small room but snapped off its base 2 years after purchasing. I'm going to look for something with more stable supports to replace this.

title: one was great the other became rickety and loud within 3 weeks
content: I bought 2, one was great the other became rickety and loud within 3 weeks.

title: Prepare to Buy Many
content: Burnt out in just over 2 months. It works well and at $13.99, it's not too difficult to replace, but that's really annoying. My last one lasted 3 years. The quality seems to have dropped off.

title: Very quiet....not what we wanted.
content: This fan is great for wind/breeze production. But we wanted a small fan for white noise....and it is virtually silent at the highest setting. Otherwise, it is a great fan. It just did not serve the purpose we were looking for.

title: Keep shopping
content: TOO LOUD!!!!!!

title: but it was pretty useful during Summer
content: Don't remember when it broke, but it was pretty useful during Summer. It's been a year and I don't have it anymore. You can't take it apart and clean the insides and I'm certain that was the reason as to why the motor continuously got stuck.

title: I had another that I used for almost 10 years that died that moved easily 3x the amount of air on high
content: This doesn't move enough air for the size. I had another that I used for almost 10 years that died that moved easily 3x the amount of air on high. Disappointing.

title: Fan clicks when adjusted.
content: Fan clicks very loudly when adjusted.  Very aggravating.  Fan itself is fairly quiet as well.  Not as loud as I would have liked.

title: Breaks down
content: This was pretty good but died.  I'm not sure how long these things last but mine didn't last too long

title: Bought Wrong Fan? ;.{
content: They,make very good fans,if you get the (Turbo-Blower-Fan),and i thought this was just a new model of that kind of (Fan),but it was not;.{{{  I have been useing there fans for about 6yrs,and i have them going 24-7--365yr,i sleep better with a fan going,for some reason?!?!?? But i STRONGLY,recomend buyiny the (Turbo),one it will blow pictures off the wall on high!! Now,this one here is more better or perfet,to move that heat and cool around your house,to save on that (Electric-Bill),it is the ideal,thing for that!! AWizard Hephzibah,Ga

title: To small
content: Its to small. The tilt on this fan stinks. The direction tilt doesnt stay in the postion you set it in. The power cord pulls the fan to a different direction. I sent it back.

title: Roommate picked up something similar for a lot less and ...
content: Roommate picked up something similar for a lot less and it's WAY more potent than this, you put a shame to the word 'Turbo'!

title: Defective stand
content: Fan broke completely off stand after six months of use with literally no warning it was going to break. There have been numerous complaints about the stand breaking, but I thought "Well, I am never going to do anything to it which could risk damaging the stand. It will sit stationary on a nightstand in my bedroom where it will be an air circulator and white noise machine." I DO move it to dust and clean. Apparently moving it from the nightstand to the dresser was enough 'wear and tear' to cause the fan to break off the base. I would recommend the FAN but the stand breaking makes it utterly useless which means if you're not intending to replace it every few months? It's not worth the money. I'm investing in a better quality product for my next fan.

title: Doesn't last long
content: Works well but after a few weeks there is a constant clicking noise that is extremely annoying. No longer use it for that reason.

title: Very quiet fan, not what I wanted.
content: I like the sound of a fan, and this is very quiet.  I want a muffler to keep out other noises and this is too quiet.

title: Two Stars
content: SAVE YOUR $ QUALITY QUESTION

title: Bad hinges, break easily making fan useless
content: The hinges where the fan meets the stand break easily. I bought 2, and in less than 18 months both broke. Would not recommend for anyone that expects the fan to be near a common walking path or to place above ground, as if the fan falls or gets kicked/bumped, the hinges will break.

title: Two Stars
content: These fans have very little force.

title: BEWARE:  CANNOT CLEAN THE FAN.  WISH I COULD RETURN IT KNOWING THIS.
content: EDIT:  after a few months, I would never buy this fan again and the designers are idiots.  Who makes a fan that you cannot take apart to clean?!!?  Their company says to use canned air.  I've done that. More money down the drain. It barely works too after a few weeks. I've used brushes and everything possible.

title: Not quite as powerful as I expected.
content: I thought I'd save a little money buying this fan over a Vornado for my home gym.  Unfortunately, it doesn't quite compare and the money saved was definitely not worth it.  Even on the highest setting, the airflow is weak and the farthest thing I'd describe from "turbo."  Would work fine for a little countertop fan, but not strong enough to contend with Texas heat or a sweaty workout.  Spend the extra money - stick with Vornado.

title: I did not like this product because the back came apart therefore I ...
content: I did not like this product because the back came apart therefore I thought this product was cheap, In addition, the ventilation was poor not enough air circulating in the small bedroom

title: Two Stars
content: broke after like a month of using it , did not really disperse air.

title: not as powerful as HT800
content: Pros:

title: Strong fan, but housed in cheap brittle parts.
content: This fan was made a cheaply as possible.  I know for the price it does what it needs to, but I do not think it will survive very long.  The on switch on my fan does not work for high speed.  I have to switch it to medium, and then try and find high somewhere.  It is very loose.  The fan housing is good, but the legs are super thin and wobbly and weak.  It allows for vibrations which equals noise.  I always move this carefully because it just feels like it is going to snap off the base.

title: Far from Turbo!!!!
content: Not very turboee..

title: Two Stars
content: I just didn't like it & it wouldn't fit in space I wanted it for.

title: I definitely concur other reviews that previous models were made a lot better.
content: It was DOA. I could get it to slowly turn if I wiggled to cord. I definitely concur other reviews that previous models were made a lot better.

title: very slow - not much of a breeze
content: I have 3 of these in our home, but the one I purchased from Amazon is very slow. I have to turn it on "hi" just to create some breeze. Not sure why this one does not work as well as the others that I purchased from a retail store.

title: Quit working after 8 months.
content: I am updating this review and taking 3 stars away, since it stopped working after 8 months.  It started going slower and slower, and now it won't spin on settings 1 and 2, and it will barely spin on the highest setting.  I'm concerned that it might catch fire if can't spin, since that energy has to go somewhere, and I imagine that the internal parts are overheating. I used it in a low dust environment, a bedroom with hardwood flooring.

title: Noisy, didnt last Two full summers.
content: These Honeywell fans used to be a great bargain for the performance. My last ones lasted a few years before needing to be replaced. This one lasted a little more than 1 full summer which is ludicrous for a small fan in this price range. If you consider summer is 3 months long, this unit lasted less than 5 months in actual usage. over the last couple of months (June/July), I noticed it loosing power or thrust. Finally it just froze. I took the cage off and if I gave it a little push on the blade, it would run again but only slow speed on the high setting.

title: Weak
content: I was expecting at least a little bit of airflow power when I ordered this product. However, at the maximum setting, I cannot even feel the airflow. I don't even bother with the lower 'I' and "II" settings because they are not even worth having on the fan. I assumed that this could replace my old HT-800 after it got broken, but it was too weak to do so. to add to my frustrations, the grille isn't even removable. Sure, there are four conventional Phillips-headed screws at the back of the grille, but there are to "Torx" bits with sections in the middle so my tools can't even get to it.

title: Not as advertised.
content: This fan is smaller than what I was led to believe. I thought I was getting the next size larger based upon the description. The one I received from this seller was the same size/model as one I already owned.  This size could be bought for much cheaper. Not as adverstised.

title: By something else
content: Doesnt blow hard at all.  I wish I bought a Vornado instead.

title: The Fan Is Not As Good As The Review
content: I can blow harder than this fan can blow.  Don't waste your time and money.  Sorry.

title: Design flaws cause it to start clunking, second fan, same thing.
content: While this fan is a nice "personal" size, and has good air flow, it has serious design flaws. This is the second one of the same fan that I've bought (because my son likes it near his bed) and both have started off nice and quiet, or at least a nice consistent white noise, but very shortly after it starts "clunking" and making uneven thunking noises, which sound like parts have come loose inside and are off balance as the motor turns. It's very annoying. I gave this fan a second chance but I wish I hadn't. I won't be purchasing another one after this. If they could correct whatever it is that loosens or falls apart in there after only a week or two they'd have a really nice fan.

title: Very, Very low power.
content: Quality construction, but the highest setting on this fan is way lower than any other fan in my house.

title: Good, but no longer.
content: Well it was good while it lasted I guess. The fan initially was reasonably quiet for the amount of air it can move, which is nice. I usually only leave it on low throughout the work day. The fan is positioned under my desk and is usually on about 8-10 hours a day, about 5 days a week.

title: Under Powered!!!!
content: I have been using fan's to sleep for about 40 years. The white noise they produce, helps me to sleep. This fan pushes air like every other fan. But, this one seems to be under powered for it's size. It's also too quiet to be useful to me. I've had the cyclone type of fans before, and am currently using one in my bedroom now. The problem is, I was planning to replace the small one in my bedroom with this lager one. The smaller cyclone is half it's size yet produces more air. I really find it strange that it is so under powered. Honeywell's are typically very powerful. I plan on keeping it because it will be too much of a hassle to return it. On the bright side, the shipment only took about a day or two to get here after purchase. I would rate the seller a 10!

title: Not as good as the previous model
content: The description states that this fan much quieter than the previous model (HT800). Well, it is, but that's because it's not as powerful. The highest setting wasn't as strong as the lowest setting on the HT800, which was disappointing. It's also not as sturdy as the HT800 and while the HT800 lasted me a few good years of moderate to heavy use, this fan only lasted about six months.

title: personal fan only
content: this is the perfect fan for a 5x5 room or for sitting at a desk for a personal fan.  Does not have the power for a bedroom

title: Disappointed
content: Doesn't measure up to my last one. Cheaper base... No weight to it. Disappointed. Do not think it will last as long as previous one.

title: Prefer a remote included one due to wired switch position
content: Product good but very wired switch position. I couldn't mount or keep on top of a table due to that. Wish I bought a remote one.

title: Well made, solid construction. Quiet on all three ...
content: Well made, solid construction. Quiet on all three speeds.  The fuse in the plug is an extra precaution.  There are supposed to be four rubber feet to protect the surface when placing the fan.  Mine has 2 (2 missing). I will ask the vendor for the 2 missing feet and advise.

title: worked great, until it stopped working
content: worked great, until it stopped working. the fan motor burned out fairly quickly within a year of owning it.

title: Noisy
content: After reading the reviews of others, I expected a quieter fan. It's not quiet at all.

title: Does not match the original high velocity fan
content: I thought these fans would match the performance of the high velocity fans, but the highest setting is about equal to the lowest setting of high velocity fan.  I would not buy again, even if they are a bargain on Amazon.  Spend a bit more and get a better performance fan with much more usable range.  If you are looking for a quieter fan, these are not that quiet at the lowest setting and after having purchased four of these identical fans, two of them make subtle vibration type noise.  Perhaps the fans are not well balanced or the motor bearing is not up to par.  Besides, air movement is minimal at the lowest setting.  I don't like to give poor reviews, but very little wiggle room with these.

title: Two Stars
content: it was o.k.

title: Didn't last long
content: Didn't last long. Started making knocking noise within few weeks

title: short lifespan, efficiency deteriorates after a couple months
content: Used this for a few months in my office to keep cool.  IF you are sitting relatively close (<5ft), there is a lot of air moved and works well.  However, the motor has started to make very loud noises when running, and it's clearly not put together with quality parts.  Cheap plastic parts can break easily.

title: Rather useless
content: Nice, cool breeze. If only it stayed in the lowest position. It's useless when the fan blows air straight up. I'm getting rid of it and getting something else.

title: Not Real Happy
content: I bought this fan as a sleep fan to drown out the snoring of the other guys on my FD and I am disappointed in this fan. The amount of air this fan produces is not what I would have expected from a fan of this size even on the high setting. It also is much quieter than previous versions of this fan. It may be good for use in a small room to move some air but in a standard beedroom or dorm room in my case, it just doesn't cut it.

title: Quite
content: I was looking for a louder fan to drown out the nose of my dog snoring. Some of the reviews complained about this fan being too loud. Not the case for this fan. If you're looking for a quiet fan I would suggest this.

title: good but too hard to clean
content: after using only more expensive Vornados, I took a chance on this cheaper Honeywell.  after a year I can say it's a great little fan for air circulation and white noise in a small bedroom, but it's such a chore to remove 5 deep-set screws in order to clean the vents and blades (unlike the Vornado's easy plastic clamps).  I can't recommend it to anyone with pet hair, lint or dust issues.

title: good quality & Powerful fan
content: A nice addition in the room. Powerful fan very less noise compared to the speed, still not much at all.

title: First one didn't work
content: The fan was completely dead upon delivery.  I sent it back and Amazon sent me another one that works fine.

title: Decent quiet fan
content: I prefer an oscillating type of fan, one that sweeps across a room as it circulates the air.  This fan does no oscillate, but for a table top size fan, it moves a fair amount of air.  Its best feature, though, is its silence -- you can hardly hear it, even when it is running on high.

title: If you want a fan for noise...
content: AVOID this one.  We use fans in our bedroom to drown out traffic noise and one of our Honeywell fans finally needed to be replaced.  I couldn't find the same model on Amazon so ordered one I thought was similar and it is way too quiet.  Don't get me wrong, the fan itself is great but if you need noise this isn't the right fan.  This will be our first return so I hope it is relatively painless!  Another product you need to see in person before you buy, I guess.

title: Fairly Good Inexpensive Fan
content: Over the past few years, I've purchased four of these fans. Criticisms regarding its limited swiveling ability are warranted, but it does a respectable job of circulating air. One of the four fans I received was dead on arrival (would not turn on, no juice), but Amazon was quick to replace it at no charge. If I need to cool a small area in the future, I would not hesitate to purchase another.

title: Decent fan.
content: I really wish they stopped trying to make fans quieter. I need a fan blowing right next to me for me to sleep and the louder it is, the better I sleep. My last fan was just like this but an older model. I feel like it was significantly stronger and louder.

title: Not a bad fan
content: I got this because the description emphasized that it can be taken apart in order to clean the front grill and blades. HA! The teeny-tiny screws are located in narrow deep wells, so I am going to have to find a long and very small phillips screwdriver. Or just replace the thing when it gets dirty, which is not an ideal solution. The angle of the fan is adjustable and clicks into fixed positions on the stand. So far, I have not managed to turn it on without pushing it through all the angle stops. You need two hands to hold it in place and another to turn on the switch. (I only have two.) I bet the plastic will wear out quickly. The knob is awkward to grip and the first speed is high, so if you want low or medium, you have to click it one or two more stops. That seems counterintuitive to me and like unnecessary wear. The fan does the job and the materials seem sturdy, but the design is a bit strange.

title: Weak motor......
content: Had two of these before to use mainly onstage for shows and they both pumped.  Ordered this one and was surprised and a little upset with the output being so weak.  Seemed like it was a smaller/weaker motor in the same exact models that I had before of this product.  The frame was also flimsier and weaker.  Still a good fan though.

title: Quiet but weak
content: I have to agree with those that label this fan wimpy. If you are accustomed to Vornado fans, this is at most like the medium level cfm on one of those. It is quiet, but just not very powerful.

title: Good fan
content: I am happy with this purchase.  Good price, powerful, light weight, and sturdy.  Only wish footprint was smaller since I use it on my desk.

title: Ok small fan
content: This is an ok fan for the price, not very powerful but its ok. YOu need to have it up close to feel the breeze.

title: It needs more power.
content: The high setting on this fan should be the low setting. It doesn't move enough air to suite me. Ya it's quiet but I would rather it worked.

title: ehhhh
content: I loved this fan before they made it quiter. Honestly I have been buying this fan for the last 10 years and it was perfect to drown out the outside noise, now... it's just a fan I have no use for.

title: Honeywell HT-904C Tabletop Air-Circulator Fan, White by Honeywell
content: Nice little fan for the money.  Powerful breeze but wish it was oscillating.  Does tilt up and down but that's it.  Well, as the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

title: Ok, but could be better.
content: I have bought this about 4 days ago. I love the Honeywell brand

title: It's a fan
content: I bought this to blow air into a crawl space under our kitchen. It works fine. It's quient and air volume is good.

title: Compact but eventually lost its quietness
content: Perfect size for small area near my desk.

title: good quiet fan
content: I bought this fan to replace one exactly like this, only that one is 10 yrs old , the motor bearing on that one was squealing badly I tried cleaning it but, no way man. Taking the unit apart is not possible and when I did, the motor cleaning, it still squealed. replacement time.

title: Works But Underpowered
content: I bought a Honeywell fan just like this a few years ago. Gave it to someone but I liked it. Bought this second one last week, price and delivery from Amazon was excellent. But this product seems different than the older one. MUCH LESS power from the elctric motor. The maximum speed feels like a middle speed, I think they cut costs and downgraded the motor. It works OK and is quiet but definitely should have a higher speed for really hot weather.

title: A very quiet fan
content: This fan is perfect for a bedroom.

title: Not for white noise
content: Don't buy this fan if you are looking for something to create white noise in a room. I have a lot of kids, so I put a fan in the nursery so my baby doesn't have to listen to every single bump and thud created by my other children during her nap times. I have several Honeywell fans that are good and loud...thought this one was the same, but it's whisper quiet on all three settings. Air output is okay, but I was disappointed it didn't serve my needs. I kept it instead of returning because return shipping would have cost me almost half of what I paid for the stupid thing in the first place. I suppose if I need a fan to circulate air in a small room, I might use it.

title: Desk Fan
content: Does a good job for a desk fan but it's not the quietest. I use it at my bedside in the hot summers and on my desk at my feet. When it's on high though I have to turn it down to low when I am on the phone or people think I am driving with the windows down. The tilt option is nice especially if you will have it placed on the floor. Only good for small areas. I only say good in rating because it's called a TurboForce which it is not.

title: Air-cirulator is not the same as a small fan.
content: It works well over all.  I'd like it to have more power and cool more but for the size and price, it does well.

title: O.K.
content: This fan is O.K. and runs quiet.  However,it does move the air as good as the old fan which was the same model but older version.

title: Disappointing
content: I've had this fan for a couple of weeks now, and after having the previous version of it, I'm pretty disappointed. I had the earlier model for just over 3 years of continuous use. When I say continuous, I mean CONTINUOUS. I had it on 24/7 on the lowest setting, very rarely turning it off. But, to even mimic the power of the last one on the lowest setting, this fan has to be on the highest setting. And, I have a feeling I'll be purchasing another fan in a much shorter time period than 3 years.

title: Good Price Decent Fan
content: Works good, Not TurboForce worthy though, works for the night stand but not that strong. It is a small guy but good price

title: not as good as the older version
content: They changed the base on the new model and now it requires 2 screws to hold it in place on a wall as opposed to 1 screw that is centered on the base. Also this one does not hold its angled position as well as the old style. Why change a good product.  I don't think it cost them any less to produce and it definitely wasn't an improvement.  Still moves air as well and may be a little quieter may be. We use it to push warm air from above our wood stove in the basement. It does that well but as I said I had to add a 2nd screw to mount it on the wall. I think my son borrowed the older version that still worked fine after 8yrs.

title: Too noisy on high setting
content: Overall a great fan for the price with the know weaknesses.  One big surprise is how noisy it is on high.  On low it is very quiet then on medium you start to hear almost a rattle noise then on high it just get LOUD.

title: Ok fan for the money.
content: These are great fans for a desk or personal use, but they are not really going to move a "turbo" amount of circulation in a room.

title: Nice Fan
content: Nice fine, but makes a very high pitch sound occasionally for a few minutes at a time.  If on during the night time and the very high pitch sound starts, it will wake you up.  Other than that the fan is very nice

title: Fine fan, possible longevity issue
content: This is a good basic fan, but this is the second I've had to buy.  The first I bought (from a local hardware store, not from Amazon) stopped working after about six months.  Bought the same kind here despite this because it's cheap and because I know it works well for my application (white noise in bedroom, specifically.  also good for drying clothes hung up after wash).

title: Good motor, but hinge eventually snaps.
content: I bought this fan to cool a ~500 sqr/ft apartment, particularly at night so I can leave the air conditioning off.  Motor consistently performed, was quiet, and actually produced quite a bit of air movement for its size.  However, the unit ended up breaking about 6 months after it was purchased.  The hinges that allow the unit to tilt are very flimsy plastic and cannot handle adjustment of the angle over time.  This unit would be better if the hinge did not exist.  Overall, a good fan with a good motor, but does not have durability to last.

title: Rattles
content: I was looking for a fan to replace our Vornado that had started rattling (my husband can't sleep with it on, and we use it as a white noise machine of sorts). This one arrived in seemingly good condition, but rattles and clicks on first use. It may have been bounced around too much during shipping, but either way, we don't use it because it keeps my husband awake. (I don't mind it, but if you are a light sleeper, beware).

title: Decent fan, but does not work for noise control!!
content: We have had Honeywell fans in our house for many years for noise control in our bedrooms.  The older version of this fan did a GREAT job of blocking unwanted noise in the room, this new model does NOT!  It is VERY quiet!  It does blow a decent amount of air, but if you are looking for some "white noise" this is NOT the fan for you!

title: Smaller than expected
content: Seems to move air but rather small. Will look for larger version. I guess key words are floor/table, more a table fan than a floor van.

title: Poor Proformance
content: I thought the fan had a stronger motor, it wasn't as powerful as I expected. But for the money still a nice buy.

title: Good while it lasted
content: This is a good fan that pushes around a lot of air for it's size and it's very quiet as well. I used it to help circulate heat from a vent free propane heater and it worked well. Kept the air circulated and the room warm from floor to ceiling. Just one problem.... it only worked for 33 days. On day 33 it worked in the morning, I shut it off, then later in the day tried to turn it back on and it just wouldn't turn on anymore. I typically ran it 14 hours a day and 24 hours on weekends. Today, after 33 days, it no longer works, it will not power on.

title: Good air flow, but loud
content: I was looking for a quiet fan for my office. This has good air flow, but the motor/blades have a loud hum even on the lowest speed.

title: Get what ya get for the price
content: For the price this really is a good fan. But I would suggest getting it if you won't use it a lot. I ran it at all night and a little during the day. After 9 days it died. My parents have one and use it only a little during the day and it's worked great for them.

title: okay
content: Does what it is suppose to do. I have it on counter next to where I sit while I game.

title: Great Little Fans
content: These fans are not super powerful but they do what we need to do. They are a good weight feel nice and sturdy.

title: quiet, low pressure fan, not Turbo
content: This fan is fine for close range use, like a desk.  I'm rating this fan a 3 star since it's advertised as "Turbo" implying more power.  If you are trying to create a significant draft in a large room, say larger than 12x12 feet, I would go with a model with more power and less focus on being quiet.  This works well for low volume white noise.  It balances fine and is nicely adjustable.

title: Not enough power for a small office.
content: I bought this fan to use in a small office. It did not have enough power to move the air, and I returned it.

title: Fan
content: It was not as good I had hoped it would be...and it is too cumbersome. I will probably sell it in a garage sale and someone could

title: get a vornado
content: you deserve it and it works better..much better..long term thinking.  this fan was big but not that powerful as i expected.

title: Quiet, but low output
content: I bought this fan to replace a much older honeywell fan of similar design purchased from Costco (in a two-pack). This fan was smaller than expected, and while very quiet, did not move nearly the same amount of air as its older, larger, louder predecessor. I like that this model has a round "physical" knob for selecting between the three speeds (the older model had an electronic "button" which eventually failed after a few years). I feel that the knob will last much longer than the previous-generation's button but that's the limit of my praise for this fan.

title: Small but effective
content: I wanted a fan that  I could use to dry out a small basement closet when some water would come in during major storms (after the soil has been oversaturated).  The fan works fine but I do wish it was a bit larger.  My main complaint though is that the pivoting fan can only be adjusted so that it is 90 degrees to the base.  I wish it would pivot more so I can direct it better at the floor.  But this is probably not a conern for most folks.

title: Kind of misleading, and it didn't work 1st time
content: If I had not gotten a replacement fan my review would be 1 star because while it was delivered on time, which was nice, it was faulty. For whatever reason the fan just wouldn't turn on. So, I got my replacement in 3 days and I have to say I'm still pretty dissatisfied. It's called "Turboforce" but even on the 3rd setting it feels like someone is just blowing on me themselves. And the 2nd and 1st settings are so weak you can only feel it if your standing /right/ in front of it. The advertisement says it's supposed to circulate air through a whole room/s, but it can barely even circulate air in my tiny apt space. It is quiet though (on the the 1st and 2nd settings, the 3rd is actually pretty loud), but the air strength is ridiculous for something called "turboforce." Or maybe I just got another faulty product.

title: Turbo should not be in the name...
content: Bought 2 of these to cool down my computers, not very good since the wind force it generates is so weak.

title: good for the price
content: you get what you pay for. it's a cheap looking fan. feel it's on when you sit sooooooo close to it.

title: It's Okay, but definitley NO hurricane!
content: After reading tons of reviews on mini fans, I decided to purchase this Honeywell TurboForce fan.  On level HIGH, this fan does not produce the tornado I was expecting.  It's just mediocre at best.

title: Okay
content: The fan doesn't put out much noise but just enough to use as white noise. It does not have much power so for a small room/office it is nice.

title: quieter now
content: We bought this fan to replace an older version that was acting wonky. We love it at night for the white noise, but this one is much quieter. Obviously, if that's what you're looking for this is great, but I know a few people who use it for white noise, so I thought I'd mention that it is now quieter. Otherwise, it works well.

title: I need more power
content: Not quite as powerful as I'd hoped. It was cheap though so I can't complain. I will buy the more powerful one next time

title: Doesn't Really provide enough FAN POWER
content: I bought this fan because I like a fan blowing on me when I sleep, because the cats crawl on me and make me hot & I like an adjustable fan aimed at my head....This fan was too small to do much good, so I ordered the next Honeywell TurboForce up.....and that one works fine for my needs....I didn't return this fan because of the return shipping amt.  It was cheaper to keep the fan...I will probably find SOME use for it somewhere, Sometime....

title: honeywell fan
content: well, this particular fan was way smaller than I thought it was going to be, but it does the job.

title: Powerful, but not durable
content: I like the fan, it's quiet and very powerful.  Unfortunately the stand broke after one day.  It still works, but I have to prop it up to get it to work.

title: Noisier than the ealier model I had
content: I had a similar Honeywell fan that lasted 10 years, and this was a replacement. It has one more speed, but is the same otherwise. The most important aspect for me is noise, and this one is much less quiet than the one it replaced.

title: Blows air. Sucks as a white noise maker.
content: Functional, but worthless for white noise. If you want a quiet fan, this is the one for you. If you're wanting it for air flow AND noise, look elsewhere.

title: Okay
content: The fan was not as large, or as strong or powerful as I had hoped...but I guess it is adequate.

title: Usually dont have an issue, this unit does
content: This one is making noise from the start, something sounds a little loose. Usually they dont do that until the age

title: Useless fan
content: Weak fan power, hardly pushes any air especially for the amount of noise this mechanism makes.  Will not be using it.  Not worth enough to return.  Will likely throw this away.

title: Honeywell HT900
content: It was a great source of air, but it was extremely noisy. We use a fan at night to sleep, but couldn't sleep from the noise from the fan.

title: Loud
content: It was rated by many as being whisper quiet, but it is anything but. As far as using it in the bedroom, unless you are a very sound sleeper, it just is too loud. Fine machine, but too loud, definitely not "whisper quiet" as advertised.

title: Can't rate, bought as gift
content: The people that received this gift seem to be real happy with it but for me to say this or that about this product would be unfair.  I know they like it and have not complained about it with any issues.  Your on your own on this product,

title: you get what you paid for
content: The fan is very quiet and powerful compared to its size. The fan base is not sturdy as it will shake a lot while changing the speed.

title: Not that great
content: Unfortunately, I was influenced by some reviews and elected to purchase this fan over a different one - which I'm not having to buy. Let me save you the trouble, spend 10-15 more and get a good fan. Although he is pretty inexpensive and seems to have a good rating, he is very weak. Not only that, but the air stream is surprisingly too focused. If we put 5 feet from us, only one of us will feel the air. When we put if 8 feet away, still, only one of us will feel the slightest breeze. Any further, and you can't even tell there's a fan pointed at you. I should have listened to the other reviewers on here saying that this model has been changed.

title: strong
content: i bought this for a desk fan but it is a bunch too strong for me, it is kind of noisey and rumbles on the desk surface. i bought the watermelon fan and have switched this loud one to the living room for some added circulation in there. it is fine in the living room.

title: its a fan
content: This is my third one the first one wore out after about a year the second a little longer.  I keep buying them because I have a small night stand and it fits there and it puts out a good breeze with just enough noise to drown out back ground noise. This one had a little bit of a twist to it and would not stand up very well.  I got mad trying to adjust it and it busted the base but now it sits straight. I give it 3 stars because they do not last long.

title: I miss the old versions of these fans.
content: These fans used to truly be turbo fans, blasting a ton of air in one direction. Now they claim they are quieter, and they are, because they aren't nearly as powerful as they once were in the past. They still function and put out a decent amount of air, but they are nothing compared to what these were years ago.

title: Decent fan
content: An ok fan, works fairly well.  It is quiet but not that powerful in terms of air circulation.  Sort of wishing I'd shelled out the extra $ for the Vornado.

title: Honeywell Whole Room Air Circulator Floor/Table Fan
content: It works well, although I expected it a bit bigger. The main problem is that at the low scales it is noisy...

title: Hit or Miss
content: I'm giving 3 stars because these fans are hit or miss.  I've bought several over the years from Amazon.  One is still working great.  The second had all the things wrong with it that other reviewers complain about.  It was a piece of junk and died.  The third is much better quality.  For the price point, it's fine.  You just may get a reliable one or a malfunctioning one.

title: Not bad
content: Fan works well and has a good amount of power for its size and it is pretty quiet.  Downside is that it is very difficult to clean

title: Inconvenient control knob - better options exist
content: I bought this Honeywell fan along with the Lorell Desk Fan, 12 Oscillating, 11-5/12x13-15/16x19-21/43 or use in a bedroom and our living room. His is a compact fan that can fit into tighter spaces than an oscillating fan.  While it does seem to move a reasonable amount of air, I find myself turning it to high speed to match the performance of the less expensive Lorll at medium or even low setting.  This is a relatively quiet fan but there is something that's a little more noticeable about the noise it creates  compared to the Lorell which I personally believe is related to the style of grille and less efficient blade.  My nine year old son actually prefers this fan over the Lorell oscillating fan because of the sleeker design but I prefer function over form.

title: Not as strong as I thought, and has burning plastic smell.
content: Maybe it should not be called "turbo" fan.

title: good deal for the price but...
content: Definitely awesome for the price, but I have an older version of this fan that just died and I thought I was buying the same thing, but it is definitely not as powerful as the older models.

title: Okay If Pointed Directly At You
content: Makes a nice cooling breeze but you have to have it pointed right at you. Definitely not a whole room circulator. Attractive sleek  housing and runs on the quiet side. Definitely go with something bigger if you're trying to turn over a whole room worth of air.

title: Not made by Honeywell
content: I called Honeywell to get clarification on their fans and was forwarded to the actual company who makes the fans. Nevertheless, the fan is rather loud and doesn't pack much punch. It's okay for a small room.

title: They were a little smaller than I had thought they might be.
content: They were kind of small but for a personal fan I believe it will suit the need it was intended for.

title: Wasn't as strong as I had hoped for
content: I bought this while living in Hawaii since almost no place there has air conditioning. I would have to have it in bed with me just to feel it.

title: I "loved" this fan
content: Yes, at current, PAST tense. I bought it February 8, 2014.... last night I went to turn it on, it was DEAD. I noted there was a fuse (with an extra) in the plug, but changing it didn't seem to do much good....

title: It works
content: We use this fan in my sons bedroom, so perhaps a 10x10 sq foot space, not very large, and I find it works just okay. I really thought based on others reviews it would work well, but if I were to use it in our master bedroom or living room, it wouldn't do much of anything.

title: Quiet and powerful, but doesn't hold up over time
content: Very quiet for a small $15 fan.

title: Doesn't last that long
content: We use fans a lot, and this one just kind of dies after a few months. In my opinion, that is too quick.

title: Why are all these fans so bad?
content: The prices on fans never decrease, but the quality keeps going down year after year!  This fan looked like a quality product, but I have two of them, and within just a couple of weeks of use they've both started making lots of noise.

title: I am disappointed in its performance
content: I am disappointed in its performance.  IT IS NO BETTER THAN A REGULAR FAN AND SHOULD NOT ADVERTISE IT AS A WHOLE ROOM CIRCULATOR

My buddy and I bought the exact same model at the exact same time. Mine is working perfectly and I would give it 5 stars, but his is already making a rattling noise and he is returning it. If you get a good one, you are golden. I can't believe I hadn't purchased it sooner. If you get a bad one...well you know.

title: The power button is a bit annoying to reach
content: Decently quiet. The power button is a bit annoying to reach.

title: good price - works well to keep computer cool - but I expected more power
content: not the power I would expect from Honeywell.  But works fine for keeping my computer cool and it was a good price

title: Quiet, too little air movement
content: Very quiet. Moves far less air than I had expected.

title: Decent for comfort cooling but NOT for ventilation
content: Decent for the price.  Don't expect this to ventilate a room or help dry a mopped floor, though!

title: Three Stars
content: It's very weak, even on the highest setting.

title: Gentle breeze fan
content: Advertised as a Turbo Force Power Air Circulator but honestly its a cheep small fan. Good for a nightstand. Anything lower than the highest setting is a joke. If your in the market for a small gentle breeze fan, this ones for you.

title: Three Stars
content: not as big as I expected. Goes well for a very small space

title: Hard to clean
content: Unlike many fans this one  does not dismantle to be able to clean the blades and surface dust.  My husband picked up some pipecleaners and spent about one hour tediously cleaning it over a garbage bag. Next small fan will definitely be one I can take apart.  I merely bought this for the bathroom shelf, our bathroom does not have a window, nor do we have air conditioning.  We do have an exhaust fan.  It is a new condo and nowadays they are making these windowless bathrooms, a new concept for me.

title: Smaller than expected
content: I have a couple honeywell fans from many years ago that still run strong. It seems like Honeywell stopped making the size in between the largest and next size down. I was surprised with how small this one was.

title: Good but not as well thought out as I would have liked
content: Fan puts out a good amount of air for the physical size. I must admit I thought fan would be larger. The 3 speeds have a good range between them. Seems pretty well constructed except the switch seems a little flimsy. I would be nice if it allowed a slight downward adjustment in case you have to put it on a higher shelf.

title: Good for Desktop; Inadequate for Whole Room
content: Actually, we were disappointed, but it was our own fault for not reading the description more carefully. The photograph doesn't show the fan against any setting or objects, and so we thought we were getting a full size floor fan. My son's bedroom is very hot in summer. We have a window unit, but he is an adult and his bedroom has just a sliding door, so there's no place to put up a window unit. We wanted a powerful fan for him, and this isn't it. The "whole room" label isn't really accurate.

title: You get what you pay for, this fan is ...
content: You get what you pay for, this fan is cheap and it does move air, but it's a little noisy and very cheaply made. We'll see how long it lasts.

title: Only ok.
content: It does the job. But, there is the setting dial issue that bugs me.

title: Three Stars
content: It works well for the price.

title: Fan works great! Plastic housing is less than desirable.
content: For the price, this fan is certainly more than adequate.  However, the plastic construction is particularly dubious at the rotating joint axes.  This is the second of these fans that I have purchased and they both crack and break with little manipulation at these points.  It is a design flaw that reduces the quality of the product.  The fan works quite well and moves air as advertised, but this product gets three stars for overall poor craftsmanship.

title: Adequate but a downgrade from older Honeywell
content: Not same quality or performance as unit from 10 years ago.  Wobbly base gives cheap feel.  Air flow feels less than old model but is adequate on high and is quieter.

title: It'll do
content: This doesn't have as much power as I'd like.  Ok, but only for a small space.

title: Three Stars
content: Fan does blow as much air as the older model but it is quieter.

title: but it makes a rattling noise that is very annoying. I probably got a bad one and should ...
content: The fan moves a lot of air, but it makes a rattling noise that is very annoying.  I probably got a bad one and should have returned it but I already threw out the box.

title: Don't be fooled!  Newer HT-908 fans are not the same as the original HT-908.
content: This HT-908 fan actually has two versions.  The older version is a much better fan and far more powerful than this new version.  What you're buying here is the new model where they replaced the powerful motor which a much less powerful motor (and probably cheaper!) and somehow this becomes an advertising feature of "30% Quieter".  I compared my old and new HT-908 fans side by side and the new HT-908 on high is equal to the old HT-908 on medium.  Very disappointing.  Not only that, my old fan has starting cracking on the plastic around the top handle section.  So don't expect these fans to last more than five years if you're lucky.

title: EVERYONE IS WRONG.
content: This fan is wayyyyyyyyy louder then the one i had before it, the only reason i got this fan is because it was supposedly "scary quiet".

title: problem with base of fan
content: i have bought 2 of these fans because they work well. The only problem that i have had is the bottom base the fan sets on has broken off of both fans.The fan still works but i have to set it into something to hold it up.

title: Good desk fan...nothing "turbo force" about it ...
content: not as powerful as i was expecting...I was looking for something to move the heat from my pellet stove on the 1st floor of my house up to the 2nd floor....I was going to mount it to the wall at the bottom of the stair... I didn't even attempt to mount it b/c it doesn't have the "turbo force" needed

title: Three Stars
content: a little bit small, quiet

title: 3rd purchase
content: It is fine, but truly NOT a long lasting product.

title: but not good for exteriors
content: Small and light, but not good for exteriors.

title: Works well but a bit loud.
content: Works well but a bit loud.

title: smaller than expected
content: not as great as everyone says

title: Three Stars
content: Not that quiet

title: The only thing I don't like is the control switch
content: The only thing I don't like is the control switch. It's  too easy to go past high & be on low ,which of course is hard on motor , due to the force it takes to move switch.

title: Covers the basics, but stops there.
content: I use this for a desk fan at my office, since it was starting to get too hot in there -- and didn't want to keep complaining about the temperature. This does the job of keeping me cool, and is really the perfect size for my desk area. Not too big that it looks weird, and not too small that it can't pump out some wind.

title: Three Stars
content: I thought it was going to be bigger

title: noisey
content: A bit noisey

title: Very deep back. More substantial than it looks in ...
content: Very deep back.  More substantial than it looks in pics takes up alot of space... bulky!  Work well though!

title: Like my marriage, started great with a noise, messy downward spiral that ended in the trash
content: This fan was perfect for my office. I need a fan blowing air directly at my face 24/7. Always. I was so impressed by how quiet and strong this fan was that I bought two more for my home and loved it.  However, my desk fan took a horrible turn. It started shaking and squeaking like a WWII bomber that just took flak to the engine. My VP of operations became so annoyed by it that I took a shot at dousing it with WD40. Not a good idea to have that spraying in your face. Finally, I just dumped it and the company bought me a brand new fan of the same model that's working great.

title: Three Stars
content: i thought it was smaller than it was.

title: I used this fan for about a year before inexplicably ...
content: I used this fan for about a year before inexplicably the rivets that held the fan to the base broke on both sides. I use this in an office, so it was not being mishandled. Now I just prop it up against a wall to use. Otherwise the fan is still working after a couple of years of use.

title: It works, doesn't move THAT much air
content: This fan does everything it claims, but it just doesn't measure up to previous Honeywell models. I bought this fan after reading reviews that it didn't measure up to previous identical-looking Honeywell models and those reviews were correct. It's fairly quiet, but "TurboForce" is really an overstatement. The airflow is enough, but certainly not turbo or forceful.

title: Not very powerful.
content: Meh. It's okay. I wish I'd bought one that was more powerful.

title: Fan works well... pieces of the case popped off.
content: I like the fan itself except that when I tilted up for the first time pieces popped off both sides.

title: Replacements came in fine.
content: Ordered 5 fans, 3 fans that came had cracked pivot points were the stand and the fan come together.

title: Works, Just Not Very Strong
content: I bought this to put into our mudroom where my animals sleep at night because the air flow from our central unit isn't as strong on that far end of the house as I would like. It works okay and would be great as a desk fan, but doesn't come anywhere close to providing the air circulation from my Vornado fans like I was hoping.

title: Waste of money!
content: Does not work as described. You can barely feel the air blowing. I would never buy this again.

title: spend the extra money and get a vornado nothing compares
content: Good for the price but coming from a vornado, was let down by the strength

title: Three Stars
content: Somewhat loud

title: Three Stars
content: Worked great for awhile, its really slowed down now.  The high feels like the original low.

title: Perfect if your room is only 3' x 5'...
content: So I wouldn't say this is a "whole room" air circulator unless that room is a tiny closet. We purchased three of these fans and are quite underwhelmed and disappointed by the lackluster performance of these units. If you want a fan that circulates air, keep movin' this is NOT the fan for you... look for the industrial Lasko's (they have two plug ins on the side) or the large round Lasko's.

title: Still seems great for the price when looking at what is out ...
